critique: This document reestablishes the Toiyabe National Forest by combining two divisions from other National Forests. It is signed by the President and based on a recommendation from the Secretary of Agriculture, citing the act of June 4, 1897. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, national security concerns, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The document seems to be an administrative action related to land management and federalism.
